title: Mean Value Theorem Explorer
description: Interactive visualization of the Mean Value Theorem showing secant lines connecting interval endpoints and tangent lines at a draggable point c. Students explore finding values where the instantaneous rate of change equals the average rate of change.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Derivatives
Mean Value Theorem
learningObjectives: Apply the Mean Value Theorem to find values of c where the tangent slope equals the secant slope
Calculate and compare secant and tangent slopes for various functions
Demonstrate understanding of when MVT conditions are satisfied
prerequisites: Understanding of derivatives and their geometric meaning
Knowledge of secant and tangent lines

controls.name: Point c
controls.description: Draggable point on the curve between a and b

controls.name: Auto-find c
controls.description: Animates to a c value that satisfies MVT

controls.name: Show secant
controls.description: Toggle visibility of the secant line

variables: c - point where tangent is evaluated
limitations: Square root function only valid for x >= 0
